name: Qalam Education Fund
mission:
Inspiring growth through nurturing education built on a sacred foundation.

We envision a community that thrives off of accessible Islamic knowledge and...
theoryOfChange: Inspiring growth through a three-pronged approach: Ta'leem (Learning), Tarbiya (Personal growth), and Suhba (Mentorship) to transform individuals into better people in line with Prophetic personality.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.qalam.institute/zakat (Source: https://www.qalam.institute/zakat)

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fi_sabilillah (+5)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 32/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, education global cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; good program ratio (≥75%) suggests reasonable delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Build working capital reserves to 1-3 months of operating expenses
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes for 3+ years

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with causal pathway
components.name: Theory of Change

judge_issues.message: The rationale states "exceptional financial efficiency and stability" which is not fully supported by the score of 44. The score is significantly impacted by the lack of impact evidence and third-party verification, which should be more prominently highlighted in the rationale.

The impact rationale mentions capacity building but doesn't fully explain the low impact score (18/50). It should emphasize the missing beneficiary data, excessive working capital, lack of evidence and outcomes, weak governance, and developing theory of change, which significantly lowered the score.
BBB name 'Tree Research and Education Endowment Fund' may not match 'Qalam Education Fund' (similarity: 40%)
Evaluation source domain 'projects.propublica.org' is not a known trusted evaluator

risks.risk_summary: Key concern: Board too small: 2 members

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Qalam Education Fund Inc earns 44/100 due to good alignment and limited impact, with zakat compliance (significant risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.qalam.institute/zakat (Source: https://www.qalam.institute/zakat)

The organization is zakat-eligible and maintains a specific zakat policy.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization demonstrates exceptional financial efficiency and stability, though its overall score is moderated by a need for more direct impact evidence and third-party verification.
areas_for_improvement: Limited external impact data regarding long-term beneficiary outcomes
Need for increased transparency through third-party charity ratings

dimension_explanations.alignment: Qalam shows high alignment for Muslim donors as a zakat-eligible institution that addresses the urgent need for global Islamic education [2][8]. Its diverse programming, from podcasts to professional seminaries, serves a wide range of community needs [4][7].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization focuses on capacity building through intensive educational tracks like the Alimiyyah program [4][5]. While it maintains a strong program expense ratio of 81.2%, the direct cost per beneficiary is not fully disclosed, leading to a balanced impact assessment [1][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: Qalam Education Fund Inc provides accessible Islamic knowledge through a sacred educational foundation and robust financial management.
strengths: High fundraising efficiency with only $0.01 spent per $1 raised
Significant liquidity with 109.7 months of working capital
Strong commitment to program services, allocating 81.2% of expenses to core missions
baseline_narrative.summary: Qalam Education Fund Inc is a non-profit organization dedicated to nurturing community growth through programs such as the Qalam Seminary, the Alimiyyah Program, and the Qalam Podcast [1][4]. The organization reported a total revenue of $2,338,320 and maintains a high program expense ratio of 81.2% [3].

all_citations.quote: Inspiring growth through nurturing education built on a sacred foundation.

all_citations.quote: Programs: Qalam Seminary, Qalam Podcast, Qalam Alimiyyah Program

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization demonstrates exceptional financial efficiency and stability, though its overall score is moderated by a need for more direct impact evidence and third-party verification.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization currently operates with a <cite id="14">small board of only 2 members</cite>, which limits independent oversight and diversity of perspective.
While the charity has a <cite id="15">documented theory of change</cite>, it lacks external evaluations and <cite id="16">failed the BBB standard for effectiveness reporting</cite>.

bbb_assessment.summary: Meets 13 of 20 BBB standards; fails on effectiveness reporting and specific program expense disclosures.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains high liquidity, which provides a safety net while governance structures are matured.
risk_factors: <cite id="16">Failed BBB standards for effectiveness policy and reporting</cite>
case_against.summary: The primary concerns involve <cite id="14">governance risks due to a small board</cite> and <cite id="16">non-compliance with BBB standards</cite> for program expense reporting and effectiveness.

confidence.data_freshness: Financial data from 2023; Candid seal from 2025
confidence.notes: Financial data is strong, but governance and impact reporting transparency are significant gaps.

alignment.explanation: Strong fit for Muslim donors with <cite id="17">verified zakat eligibility</cite> and programs serving the <cite id="21">fuqara, masakin, and riqab</cite> categories.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust the financial reporting due to <cite id="18">audited financial statements</cite> and a <cite id="19">Platinum Seal from Candid</cite>. However, credibility is tempered by <cite id="16">failing 7 of 20 BBB standards</cite>, specifically regarding effectiveness policies.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the organization should <cite id="14">expand its board size</cite> beyond two members and publish a formal effectiveness report.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by a <cite id="6">81.2% program expense ratio</cite> and a <cite id="15">documented theory of change</cite>. However, the <cite id="20">lack of beneficiary data</cite> makes it difficult to calculate cost-effectiveness.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="20">tracking and reporting specific beneficiary counts</cite> across the Seminary and Podcast programs.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Documented Theory of Change but no external evaluation

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Supports local community and educational partners

rich_narrative.headline: Qalam Education Fund Inc provides accessible Islamic knowledge through a sacred educational foundation and robust financial management.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize the preservation of sacred Islamic knowledge and want to support a high-growth educational institution with exceptional financial efficiency.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat through traditional educational asnaf
Value high-efficiency operations with near-zero fundraising costs
Interested in supporting the development of future Muslim scholars (Alimiyyah)
Prefer organizations with a strong digital presence and podcast reach
giving_considerations: The organization has excessive cash reserves, suggesting low immediate funding urgency
Governance is centralized within a very small board
Impact is measured through educational output rather than longitudinal beneficiary outcomes
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking high levels of independent board oversight or those who prioritize organizations with low cash reserves and high immediate funding needs.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects a clear strategic vision and high program spending, but a lack of third-party evaluations or beneficiary outcome tracking.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Qalam creates impact by providing accessible Islamic knowledge through seminaries, podcasts, and retreats to nurture a thriving community.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that educational programs are effectively translating into community growth and religious literacy.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: While revenue is growing rapidly, the organization holds <cite id="10">over 109.7 months of working capital</cite>, suggesting it is not in an immediate funding crisis.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: USA, Costa Rica, Saudi Arabia, Palestine

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by an <cite id="6">unusually high 100.0% program ratio</cite> compared to the <cite id="7">78.4% peer median</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on higher Islamic education
similar_organizations.name: Darul Qasim

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar organizational size and religious focus
similar_organizations.name: Najam Institute Foundation

strengths.detail: The organization spends only <cite id="8">$0.01 for every $1 raised</cite>, ensuring that nearly all donor contributions are available for programming.
Qalam allocates <cite id="6">81.2% of its expenses to program services</cite>, far surpassing the industry standard of 75%.
The charity maintains <cite id="10">109.7 months of working capital</cite> in working capital, providing a massive buffer for long-term sustainability.

strengths_deep_dive: Qalam's financial health is characterized by rapid expansion and disciplined spending. With <cite id="4">revenue reaching $2.3 million</cite> and <cite id="11">total assets of $11,717,936</cite>, the organization has the capital to support its vision of accessible Islamic knowledge. Its grantmaking activity is also notable, providing <cite id="12">$152,901 to Roots Community Inc</cite> and <cite id="13">$150,224 to Qalam Seminary Inc</cite>, demonstrating its role as a central hub for funding related educational initiatives.
rich_narrative.summary: Qalam Education Fund Inc is a religious educational institution dedicated to <cite id="1">nurturing community growth through a sacred foundation</cite>. Founded in <cite id="2">2009</cite>, the organization has evolved into a significant provider of Islamic knowledge, offering diverse programs including the <cite id="3">Qalam Seminary, the Alimiyyah Program, and the Qalam Podcast</cite>. Financially, the organization demonstrates robust growth, reporting <cite id="4">total revenue of $2,338,320</cite> in the 2023 tax year, which represents a remarkable <cite id="5">3-year revenue CAGR of 568.6%</cite>. Qalam maintains a strong commitment to its core mission, with a <cite id="6">program expense ratio of 81.2%</cite> according to recent financial filings, significantly exceeding the <cite id="7">peer program ratio median of 78.4%</cite> for global education charities. The organization also operates with extreme efficiency, spending only <cite id="8">$0.01 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions. Beyond its domestic educational footprint, Qalam engages in strategic grantmaking, distributing <cite id="9">$414,289 in domestic grants</cite> to partners such as Roots Community Inc and the Al-Qalam Foundation to further its community-building objectives.
